intro: Collomia parviflora f. lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceleaf bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, four-petaled flowers and capsule fruits. The plant features lance-shaped leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its botanical structure supports its role in pollination and seed dispersal in its native ecosystem.
